text: Ali Akbar Isfahani (Persian: علی اکبر معمار اصفهانی) was a Persian architect from the Safavid period. He was born in 1577. The exact year of his death is not known, but it happened sometime in the 17th century. He is famous for designing the Shah Mosque in Isfahan, Iran. The mosque was built between 1611 and 1631, under the rule of Abbas I of Persia. His name is written in an inscription above the main entrance of the mosque. == References == Category:1570s births Category:People from Isfahan Category:Architects
title: Ali Akbar Isfahani
